revised_title: Menstruation and Ovulation in Macacus Rhesus
tldr: The author studied the menstruation and ovulation of Macacus rhesus monkeys, observing the changes in the discharged follicles and the menstrual cycle. They also discussed the breeding habits, breeding seasons, and gestation periods of these monkeys, as well as the role of lactation in pregnancy. The research highlights the challenges in understanding the reproductive biology of monkeys due to variations in climate, food, and geographical range.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Reproductive Biology
